title: CVE-2023-28322: more POST-after-PUT confusion

profile.name: curl
profile.about: cURL is an Open Source project providing a library and command-line tool for doing internet transfers

activities.message: Sorry, I forgot to remove Supporting Material/References.

Thank you for your report!

We will take some time and investigate your reports and get back to you with details and possible follow-up questions as soon as we can!

I consider this a slightly less sever case because here you set UPLOAD true and you do *not* set POST in the subsequent request, relying only on `CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS` to switch it to POST.

Also of course, it seems unlikely to actually survive and remain unnoticed after even basic testing.

Still, the man page for CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS says it "implies" doing a POST so it is reasonable to assume that libcurl will do this.

As we agree this issue is severity low/medium I want to proceed and work on a fix in a regular PR (without mentioning the security angle). I have a tentative fix for it, but will wait a day or two for comments here before I continue.

>I consider this a slightly less sever case because here you set UPLOAD true and you do not set POST in the subsequent request, relying only on CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS to switch it to POST.

I think you are right.
However, I think libcurl users often refer to the [CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS explained][1] and the [example C source code][2].
None of these source codes specify CURLOPT_POST at POST, so I do not think this usage is uncommon.
(I think there are many people who think that setting only CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS is enough when making a POST request).

[1]: https://curl.se/libcurl/c/CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS.html
[2]: https://curl.se/libcurl/c/http-post.html

> Also of course, it seems unlikely to actually survive and remain unnoticed after even basic testing.

Yes, not only this time, but also at the time of CVE-2022-32221.

> As we agree this issue is severity low/medium I want to proceed and work on a fix in a regular PR (without mentioning the security angle). 

I got it.

> I think there are many people who think that setting only CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS is enough when making a POST request

Of course. Since the docs says it is enough I would imagine most users would think so!

Still, that's still far from getting exploited or getting hurt by this bug.

Rated **low** because it is assumed to be a slim chance of ever happening by accident since it is consistent behavior that even basic testing will repeat and reveal. There's also little to no risk for outsiders to be able to trigger this maliciously.

>Rated low because it is assumed to be a slim chance of ever happening by accident since it is consistent behavior that even basic testing will repeat and reveal. 

I understand what you are saying. But does this not also apply to the last time (CVE-2022-32221)?
What is the difference between last time and this time?
It seems the same to me.

>There's also little to no risk for outsiders to be able to trigger this maliciously.
libcurl can be used for a variety of purposes.
For example, if you have a program that communicates with a different method for each accepted request, an attacker can trigger it by simply throwing requests in a specific order.

Yes, the previous issue was very similar and should probably have been a **low** severity as well. But then is then and now is now. In that case the second request was explicitly set to POST but it still did not "take", where as this one doesn't have that.

So you are saying that you think it was Low last time too.
If so, that makes sense.
(I was surprised because I thought the board was talking about setting it to High or Middle.)

I have always wondered what to do with Severity.
I wish there were clear criteria, but it is difficult.

I will be submitting another report in a few days.
Please let me know if you have any comments on the Severity value at that time.

Here's my first advisory take

----

CVE-2023-28322: more POST-after-PUT confusion
=============================================

Project curl Security Advisory, May 17 2023 -
[Permalink](https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2023-28322.html)

VULNERABILITY
-------------

When doing HTTP(S) transfers, libcurl might erroneously use the read callback
(`CURLOPT_READFUNCTION`) to ask for data to send, even when the
`CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS` option has been set, if the same handle previously was
used to issue a `PUT` request which used that callback.

This flaw may surprise the application and cause it to misbehave and either
send off the wrong data or use memory after free or similar in the second
transfer.

The problem exists in the logic for a reused handle when it is (expected to
be) changed from a PUT to a POST.

We are not aware of any exploit of this flaw.

INFO
----

The code actually sending wrong data or doing a use-after-free is not present
in libcurl code but are only presumed scenarios that might become the outcome
of libcurl surprisingly calling the read callback in a situation where it is
not expected to.

This flaw cannot be triggered with the command line tool.

This problem is almost identical to
[CVE-2022-32221](https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2022-32221.html). A difference this
time is that setting `CURLOPT_POST` for the second transfer avoids the
problem, where as only setting `CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS` after the PUT still makes
the second transfer to a PUT and use the callback.

The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) project has assigned the name
CVE-2023-28322 to this issue.

CWE-440: Expected Behavior Violation

Severity: Low

AFFECTED VERSIONS
-----------------

- Affected versions: libcurl 7.7 to and including 8.0.1
- Not affected versions: libcurl < 7.7 and >= 8.1.0

libcurl is used by many applications, but not always advertised as such!

THE SOLUTION
------------

This time the logic is improved to avoid having two separate variable fields
holding info about HTTP method and behavior. Now there is only one, which
should make it harder to end up in such a confused middle state.

The fix for [CVE-2023-28322](https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/7815647d6582c0a4900be2e1de6c5e61272c496b)

RECOMMENDATIONS
--------------

 A - Upgrade curl to version 8.1.0

 B - Apply the patch to your local version
 
 C - Do not do mix using the read callback and postfields string on a reused
     easy handle
 
TIMELINE
--------

This issue was reported to the curl project on April 19, 2023. We contacted
distros@openwall on May XX, 2023.

libcurl 8.1.0 was released on May 17 2023, coordinated with the publication of
this advisory.

CREDITS
-------

- Reported-by: Hiroki Kurosawa
- Patched-by: Daniel Stenberg

Thanks a lot!
Published. This issue is now eligible for a bounty claim from [IBB](https://hackerone.com/ibb).

Thanks for your work. The actual monetary reward part for this issue is managed by the [Internet Bug Bounty](https://hackerone.com/ibb) so the curl project itself therefor sets the reward amount to **zero USD**. If you haven't already, please submit your reward request to them and refer back to this issue.
